purpleculture_pinyin:
qì
to build by laying bricks or stones
строить кладя кирпичи или камни
purpleculture_info: Ideographic: To cut 切 stone 石; 切 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
堆砌 [ duī qì ]: lit. to pile up (bricks); to pack; fig. to pad out (writing with fancy phrases); ornate rhetoric
铺砌 [ pū qì ]: to pave
垒砌 [ lěi qì ]: to build a structure out of layered bricks or stones
砌块 [ qì kuài ]: building block
砌砖 [ qì zhuān ]: to lay bricks; bricklaying
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 石 [ shí ] stone, rock, mineral
    • 切 [ qiè ] to cut, to mince, to slice, to carve; close to; eager
heisig_chinese_memo: As a kid I would cut stones and try to piece them together as a structure. &nbsp
Ru_trainchinese: qì: (глаг/сущ) строить, выкладывать (кирпичом или камнем); ступень
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: As a kid I would cut stones and try to piece them together as a structure. &nbsp When I learned to lay brick as a teenager it seemed really easy compared to the stones. &nbsp
humanum_full_description_en:
From " stone " to " cut " sound, the original meaning is steps. "Shuowen Xinfu": "Steps. From the stone, cut the sound." Steps. Southern Dynasty Qi Xie Tiao (Zhizhong Shusheng): "The red medicine is turned over, and the green moss is laid on it."

" Masonry " can mean spreading out bricks or building up layers and then bonding them with plaster. The Northern Wei Dynasty, Li Daoyuan, "Shui Jing Zhu-Gu Shui": "The ground wall is built with slabstones."

" Building " can also mean accumulation. Song Qinguan "Take Sha Xing": "The plum blossoms are sent in the post, and the fish pass through the ruler.

" Making " can also mean concatenation. Song Cheng Dachang's "Playing Fanlu‧ Ju": "Six pieces of sharp leather are made of slabs, and the fire is smashed in the water, and a pack of leisure is like a long time, making the kicking and fisting sudden."

" Puzzle " also refers to the old opera funny satirical action. Song Luoye's "The Drunk Man's Interview-Novel Development": "You can get words, read poems, and speak good words, making things difficult."

" Making " also refers to stringing. Ming Tang Xianzu's "The Peony Pavilion: The Spy": "I'm afraid I won't occupy the space to build a "Ma Jiao on the Jinxi Lake"." Xu Shuofang and other proofreaders: "Build, play."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " stone " to " cut ", the original meaning is steps.
humanum_full_description:
從「石」，「切」聲，本義為台階。《說文新附》：「階甃也。从石，切聲。」 臺階。南朝齊謝朓〈直中書省〉：「紅藥當階翻，蒼苔依砌上。」

　　「砌」可表示把磚石鋪開或層層壘起，用泥灰粘合。北魏酈道元《水經注‧穀水》：「地壁悉纍方石砌之。」

　　「砌」也可表示堆積。宋秦觀〈踏莎行〉：「驛寄梅花，魚傳尺素，砌成離恨無數。」

　　「砌」還可表示連綴。宋程大昌《演繁露‧鞠》：「六片尖皮砌作毬，火中燖了水中揉，一包閑氣如長在，惹踢招拳猝未休。」

　　「砌」也指舊時戲曲中滑稽笑謔的動作。宋羅燁《醉翁談錄‧小說開闢》：「曰得詞，念得詩，說得話，使得砌。」

　　「砌」還指串演。明湯顯祖《牡丹亭‧虜諜》：「俺怕不占場兒砌一箇《錦西湖上馬嬌》。」徐朔方等校注：「砌，串演。」

Chinese Definition:
Ideographic: To cut 切 stone 石; 切 also provides the pronunciation
Freq: 3221
Chinese: As a kid I would cut stones and try to piece them together as a structure.  
Meaning: lay brick
Story: As a kid I would cut stones and try to piece them together as a structure.   When I learned to lay brick as a teenager it seemed really easy compared to the stones.  

從「 石 」，「 切 」聲，本義為台階。《說文新附》：「階甃也。从石，切聲。」 臺階。南朝齊謝朓〈直中書省〉：「紅藥當階翻，蒼苔依砌上。」 「 砌 」可表示把磚石鋪開或層層壘起，用泥灰粘合。北魏酈道元《水經注‧穀水》：「地壁悉纍方石砌之。」 「 砌 」也可表示堆積。宋秦觀〈踏莎行〉：「驛寄梅花，魚傳尺素，砌成離恨無數。」 「 砌 」還可表示連綴。宋程大昌《演繁露‧鞠》：「六片尖皮砌作毬，火中燖了水中揉，一包閑氣如長在，惹踢招拳猝未休。」 「 砌 」也指舊時戲曲中滑稽笑謔的動作。宋羅燁《醉翁談錄‧小說開闢》：「曰得詞，念得詩，說得話，使得砌。」 「 砌 」還指串演。明湯顯祖《牡丹亭‧虜諜》：「俺怕不占場兒砌一箇《錦西湖上馬嬌》。」徐朔方等校注：「砌，串演。」
From " stone" to " cut" sound, the original meaning is steps. "Shuowen Xinfu": "Steps. From the stone, cut the sound." Steps. Southern Dynasty Qi Xie Tiao (Zhizhong Shusheng): "The red medicine is turned over, and the green moss is laid on it." " Masonry" can mean spreading out bricks or building up layers and then bonding them with plaster. The Northern Wei Dynasty, Li Daoyuan, "Shui Jing Zhu-Gu Shui": "The ground wall is built with slabstones." " Building" can also mean accumulation. Song Qinguan "Take Sha Xing": "The plum blossoms are sent in the post, and the fish pass through the ruler. " Making" can also mean concatenation. Song Cheng Dachang's "Playing Fanlu‧ Ju": "Six pieces of sharp leather are made of slabs, and the fire is smashed in the water, and a pack of leisure is like a long time, making the kicking and fisting sudden." " Puzzle" also refers to the old opera funny satirical action. Song Luoye's "The Drunk Man's Interview-Novel Development": "You can get words, read poems, and speak good words, making things difficult." " Making" also refers to stringing. Ming Tang Xianzu's "The Peony Pavilion: The Spy": "I'm afraid I won't occupy the space to build a "Ma Jiao on the Jinxi Lake"." Xu Shuofang and other proofreaders: "Build, play."

砌字的基本解释

砌
qì
建筑时垒砖石，用泥灰粘合：砌墙。堆砌（亦喻写文章时使用大量华丽而无用的词语）。
台阶：雕栏玉砌。

砌
qiè
〔砌末〕中国元曲中称戏曲舞台上所用的简单布景和特制的器物。亦作“切末”（“末”均读轻声）。

Build
Basic explanation of words
Build
qì
Building time barriers with masonry, glued with plaster: building walls. Stacking (also like using a lot of gorgeous and useless words when writing articles).
Steps: carved and jade columns.
Build
qiè
[Making at the end] In the Chinese Yuan opera, it is called the simple setting and special utensils used on the opera stage. It is also used as "cut to the end" ("the end" is pronounced softly).

qì, qiè
I qì
1) книжн. ступени (каменные)
雕栏玉砌 резные перила и яшмовые ступени
砌下 у основания ступеней (лестницы)
2) мостить, выкладывать (камнем, кирпичом), возводить, строить
砌路 мостить дорогу
砌一烟筒 выкладывать печную трубу
砌墙 возводить стену
砌井 строить колодец
II qiè
см. 砌末
